title: Attorney for IRS agent claiming Hunter probe being mishandled says blowback hurts all whistleblowers
description: Attorney Mark Lytle, who represents an IRS criminal supervisory agent purportedly claiming the Hunter Biden probe is being mishandled, joined 'Special Report'

title: Family of New Mexico man fatally shot by police seeks charges
description: The family of a man who was fatally shot by police in New Mexico after responding to the wrong address has asked the police chief to step down and the officers to be charged.

title: Mets' Max Scherzer suspended 10 games for foreign substance violation after rosin incident
description: Max Scherzer will miss a start after being suspended 10 games for his rosin incident during the New York Mets' 5-3 win over the Los Angeles Dodgers.

title: Texas man accused of sexually abusing children for decades, bail set at $1.3 million
description: Texas man William Bynum is suspected of sexually abusing children over four decades, Rockwall police said, and is accused of sexually assaulting a child this year.

title: Biden to officially announce re-election bid next week: reports
description: President Biden is expected to officially launch his re-election campaign for another presidential term next week, according to multiple reports.

title: Maryland prisons face severe staffing shortage
description: Maryland correctional officers said a severe staffing shortage is creating threatening conditions for guards and prisoners in state-run facilities. The report calls to fill vacancies.

title: UConn student gets additional 55 years for killing man with sword
description: Peter Manfredonia has been sentenced to a cumulative 110 years in prison, on Thursday receiving a second 55-year sentence for killing Ted DeMers with a Samurai-style sword.

title: IRS whistleblower is 'not a political person,' has documents to support Hunter Biden allegations: attorney
description: The lawyer for the IRS whistleblower alleging the Biden administration is mishandling the federal investigation into Hunter Biden told Fox News Thursday that his client is “not a political person" and does not have a “political agenda," but does have documents to support his allegations that he hopes to bring to both congressional Democrats and Republicans.

title: New Jersey sues to force pollution cleanup at 8 sites across state
description: New Jersey announced eight lawsuits and other legal actions against companies and individuals accused of failing to clean up pollutants on properties across the state.

title: LeBron James appears to keep Twitter verification; Elon Musk admits he’s ‘paying for a few personally’
description: Los Angeles Lakers star LeBron James said he didn't want to pay for Twitter Blue. On Thursday, LeBron appeared to have kept his checkmark.

title: Hawley says 'the great awokening' is destroying middle class, GOP not ready to fight back
description: Sen. Josh Hawley said the Republican Party is not prepared to fight the left's push to purge Christianity from U.S. culture.

title: Harris claims Second Amendment support while pushing for assault weapons ban: 'Literally' weapons of war
description: Vice President Kamala Harris attacked assault weapons as “literally designed to be weapons of war" despite claiming to be a supporter of the Second Amendment.

title: Kansas City man sentenced to nearly 22 years for anti-LGBTQ+ hate crime
description: A Kansas City man has been sentenced to nearly 22 years in federal prison for an anti-LGBTQ+ hate crime. The man pleaded guilty in July to violating federal hate crime laws.

title: Tom Brady threatened legal action over AI video made by comedians
description: Tom Brady threatened to take legal action against a pair of comedians who made an AI-generated video of the quarterback doing stand-up comedy.

title: Coast Guard searching for 4 missing fishermen off Massachusetts' Cape Ann
description: The Coast Guard on Thursday began a search for four missing fishermen off Massachusetts' Cape Ann near the site of an overturned vessel. None of the men, dead or alive, have been found.

title: Texas freight train smashes into pickup truck after fatal crash: watch video
description: Texas DPS officials are investigating a fatal crash that left one person dead and a truck sitting on the train tracks, which was later smashed by an incoming freight train.

title: Democrat, Republican join forces to ban members of Congress from trading stocks while on taxpayers' dime
description: Rep. Nancy Mace, R-S.C., and Rep. Angie Craig, D-Minn., teamed up to introduce a bill that would ban members of Congress from trading stocks while on the taxpayer dime.

title: Rep. DeLauro praises Buttigieg’s plan to solve ‘gender inequity’ by promoting female crash test dummies
description: Rep. Rosa DeLauro, D-Conn. praised U.S. Transportation Secretary Buttigieg at a congressional hearing Friday for allocating resources that will develop "female" crash test dummies.

title: Angels manager Phil Nevin speaks out after double ejection in single game: 'That's a first'
description: Last June, Phil Nevin served a 10 game suspension for his role in a brawl. On Wednesday, the Angels skipper managed to get thrown out of the same game twice.

title: Mariska Hargitay remembers mom Jayne Mansfield’s movie star power on what would have been her 90th birthday
description: "Law & Order: SVU" star Mariska Hargitay shared a sweet tribute to her late mother Jayne Mansfield on what would have been her 90th birthday.

title: American Airlines employee dies on Texas airport tarmac
description: An American Airlines employee died on the tarmac Thursday at Austin-Bergstrom International Airport in Texas.

title: Half of Democratic voters in key early primary state don’t want Biden to run for re-election: poll
description: Half of likely Democratic primary voters in the crucial early voting state of New Hampshire don’t want President Biden to seek re-election next year, according to a new poll

title: Mississippi soybean farm found negligent in teen employee death
description: U.S. inspectors said a South African teenage farm worker suffocated to death after falling into a grain storage bin due to Mississippi soybean farm failing to follow safety standards.

title: Man reportedly assaulted cops, fireman while in custody for Vermont airport disturbance
description: A 63-year-old man has been admitted to a hospital after attempting to kick, bite, and headbutt authorities while in custody for a Burlington International Airport disturbance.

title: Gay pride parade canceled in southeast Florida after anti-drag show law passes
description: A gay pride parade has been canceled in southeast Florida after an anti-drag show law was passed. GOP Gov. Ron DeSantis signed a bill that would keep children from viewing drag shows.

title: Sen. Fetterman tweets image holding 420 flag to acknowledge cannabis holiday
description: Sen. John Fetterman, D-Penn., signaled his support of marijuana legalization, holding up a "420" flag, referencing the unofficial cannabis holiday.

title: Colorado driver killed by rock thrown through her windshield
description: A 20-year-old Colorado driver was killed by a rock that was thrown through her windshield Wednesday night. The suspect stands accused of throwing rocks at multiple vehicles over a two-hour span.

title: AI researchers claim Google, '60 Minutes' spread ‘disinformation’ in recent interview: ‘Still bulls---'
description: AI researchers on Twitter have claimed that both Google and CBS' "60 Minutes" peddled "disinformation" about the capabilities of artificial intelligence.

title: Vanderbilt GOP rips Dems' boycott of trans kids debate as attack on free discussion: 'Getting worse and worse'
description: Vanderbilt College Republicans Noah Jenkins and Shane Mumma weighed in after left-wing campus groups called for boycotts against a debate on gender-affirming care for minors.

title: Missouri Supreme Court set Aug. 1 execution for man who killed 6-year-old
description: The Missouri Supreme Court has set August 1 as the execution date for a man who killed a 6-year-old girl in 2022. The girl's body was found burried beneath rocks and debris

title: PGA Tour pro Patrick Cantlay responds to mounting pace-of-play criticism following Matt Fitzpatrick's remarks
description: Matt Fitzpatrick, the 2023 RBC Heritage winner, called out the pace of play on the PGA Tour after his final round of the tournament, which finished in around five hours.

title: US invests $80M in alternative solar tech, more solar for renters
description: The United States has invested $80 million in alternative solar tech that would make solar energy more available for renters. Eight of the projects focus on improving solar panel recycling.

title: Teenage PA supermarket employee charged after needles found in groceries
description: An underage employee at a Lower Macungie Township, Pennsylvania supermarket will be charged in connection with sewing needles found hidden in purchased groceries.

title: Curt Schilling rips ‘incoherent’ MLB rules that led to Mets’ Max Scherzer ejection
description: Curt Schilling, host of "The Curt Schilling Baseball Show" on OutKick, explained why he was "blown away by umpires ejecting New York Mets starter Max Scherzer on Wednesday.

title: Michigan Senate committee doles out $175M for Chinese-owned EV battery plant
description: A Michigan Senate committee granted final legislative approval to the allocation of $175 million in state funds for Chinese manufacturer Gotion's planned factory in Big Rapids.

title: Residents erupt as Michigan Democrats approve funding for Chinese-backed green energy project: 'I'm angry'
description: Several Michigan residents spoke up Thursday during a state Senate hearing where Democratic lawmakers approved public funding for a Chinese company's electric vehicle battery plant.

title: California boy, 10, dies after fight at trampoline park
description: California police say a 10-year-old boy died from injuries sustained during a fight with another child at a trampoline park in Merced on April 13.

title: New York City mom groped, punched in front of 5-year-old son on Harlem bus
description: A New York City suspect reportedly groped a mother in front of her child on an MTA bus in Harlem, while a female suspect reportedly punched the victim after she slapped the man.

title: New York City deli employee nearly stabbed, shot in Brooklyn store
description: In New York City, a male suspect is wanted for allegedly punching and attempting to stab and shoot a clerk at a Canarsie, Brooklyn deli.

title: Alvin Bragg promises not to prosecute theft to establish 'racial equity' balance: 'Crime of poverty'
description: The Manhattan District Attorney, Alvin Bragg, said that he would not prosecute 'crimes of poverty,' such as thievery before he was elected into office.

title: Virginia man wielding sledgehammer released after breaking into ex-girlfriend's home, returns next day: Police
description: A Virginia man tried using a sledgehammer to break into a home twice in two days, authorities said.

title: No bail for Chinese businessman indicted in $1B fraud case
description: Self-exiled Chinese businessman Guo Wengui has been denied bail after a federal judge rejected a $25 million package allowing his release.

title: Former Marlins exec rips Derek Jeter's front-office leadership, says he's better 'pitchman' for Subway
description: Derek Jeter became part owner of the Marlins in 2017 to try to turn the franchise around, but it did not work, and the president he fired is laughing.

title: Alabama mass shooting: Police make 5th arrest in Dadeville Sweet 16 massacre
description: Alabama law enforcement authorities arrested a fifth suspect in connection to a mass shooting at a Sweet 16 birthday party in Dadeville that left four people dead last weekend.

title: Clippers' Kawhi Leonard ruled out for Game 3 against Suns with knee sprain
description: Los Angeles Clippers star Kawhi Leonard has been ruled out for Thursday night's game against the Phoenix Suns due to a sprained right knee.

title: New bipartisan caucus in Congress condemns poisoning of Iranian girls
description: A new Congressional bipartisan caucus is condemning the Iranian government for the poisoning of school girls, which amplified the growth of criticism in Washington against the Islamic Republic.

title: Alabama corrections supervisor convicted of federal charges
description: A former Alabama corrections supervisor has been convicted of federal charges for writing false reports to cover up the 2020 beatings of three prisoners at Draper Correctional Facility.

title: Hawaiian officials block off section of famed Waikiki beach for baby monk seal
description: Hawaiian officials blocked off a stretch of Waikiki beach in order to protect the monk seal pair. They are expected to hold a press conference on Thursday.

title: Ugandan president refuses to sign LGBTQ bill, seeks changes
description: Uganda's President Yoweri Museveni refused to sign a controversial new bill into law that prescribes the death penalty in some cases for homosexual activity

title: What is Snapchat AI? Instant messaging app rolls out its ChatGPT-powered AI chatbot
description: The new update allows users send their Snapchats to My AI and receive a chat reply and bring the bot into conversation with friends.

title: China rivals US foothold in Antarctica, builds base with potential to eavesdrop on neighbors
description: China currently lags behind the U.S. Antarctic presence - the largest of any nation on the continent - but its fast-growing presence could rival the U.S. within decades.

title: Amazon seeks $153M in state incentive funds from Virginia for HQ2 project
description: Amazon submitted an application asking Virginia for about $153 million in state incentive payments. This will be the first set of funds paid out since the company agreed to build its second headquarters there.

title: Detroit-area man pleads no contest to killing news anchor
description: Arthur Williamson of Pontiac, Michigan pleaded no contest to killing WWJ-AM overnight anchor Jim Matthews and wounding his girlfriend and children in an attempted murder-suicide.

title: Israeli embassy opens near Turkmenistan's Iran border
description: Israeli Foreign Minister Eli Cohen opened the nation's Turkmen embassy on Thursday, located just 16 miles from the Iranian border in the Central Asian nation's capital, Ashgabat.

title: Major pro-life group threatens to oppose Trump candidacy over 'morally indefensible' abortion position
description: Susan B. Anthony Pro-Life America, a major pro-life group, ripped former President Donald Trump over his belief that abortion law should be decided at the state level.

title: Ohio amusement park implements 'chaperone policy' after 'unruly' behavior
description: An Ohio amusement park is implementing a 'chaperone policy,' which requires individuals ages 15 and under to be accompanied by an adult in the park after 4 p.m.

title: Cattle raiding by jihadis soars in Mali, fueling conflict
description: Cattle raiding by Islamic extremists has soared in Mali, with jihadis linked to al-Qaida and the Islamic State groups stealing $10,000 worth of cattle to buy weapons and vehicles.

title: Senior Malian official among 4 dead in ambush in jihadi area
description: Mali's government said a senior official and three other people were killed in an ambush in an area of the country’s southwest. The attack occurred in an area where Islamic extremists are active.

title: Maine jury rules in favor of $1B plan connecting US grid to Canadian hydropower
description: Maine jurors sided with developers in a complicated case determining whether they had a right to proceed with a project approved by regulators but rebuked by voters.

title: Journalist Matt Taibbi threatened with prison time for perjury by top Democrat over Twitter Files testimony
description: Rep. Stacey Plaskett, D-V.I., is accusing independent journalist Matt Taibbi of perjury over an apparent error he made during last month's House Judiciary hearing on the Twitter Files.

title: Former WWE wrestler charged with theft of millions from Mississippi welfare program
description: Ted DiBiase Jr., who used to wrestle under WWE's "The Legacy" group, has been charged in Mississippi's largest fraud case in state history.

title: Kevin Harvick set to become 10th driver with 800 NASCAR Cup Series starts this weekend at Talladega
description: Kevin Harvick is set to join rare company this weekend when he will make the 800th NASCAR Cup Series start of his career at Talladega Superspeedway.

title: 'White Lotus' star blames 'jokes' for sexual misconduct claims after being fired from another show
description: "White Lotus" star F. Murry Abraham issued a statement to Fox News Digital addressing the allegations of sexual misconduct on the set of the AppleTV+ series "Mythic Quest."

title: Indianapolis police officers shot at, injured by suspect armed with AR-15, following high-speed pursuit
description: A suspect who was armed with an AR-15 was killed in a shootout with police Thursday after refusing to be pulled over and leading officers on a high-speed chase.

title: Tom Brady asked about unretiring and playing for Miami Dolphins, provides interesting answer
description: Seven-time Super Bowl champion Tom Brady was asked if there was any chance of him coming out of retirement and playng for the Miami Dolphins.

title: Virginia cat weighing nearly 40 pounds is adopted in mere hours: ‘That’s my cat’
description: An overweight cat named Patches was adopted within a day — meet the nearly 40-pound animal that a Virginia rescue knew would spark lots of conversation.

title: Andrew Cuomo reappears to slam left's 'defund the police' and 'tax the rich' slogans
description: Former New York Gov. Andrew Cuomo argued against lawmakers using slogans such as "tax the rich" and "defund the police" in a recent op-ed for the New York Daily News.

title: Hailey Bieber opens up about 'saddest, hardest moments' after receiving death threats
description: Hailey Bieber revealed she's been feeling "fragile" during her "saddest" and "hardest moments" in 2023. Hailey has received death threats over a rumored feud with Selena Gomez.

title: Missouri former high school football coach pleads guilty to 18 child sex crimes: reports
description: A Missouri judge sentenced a former high school football coach to 10 years in prison after he pleaded guilty to 18 child sex crimes, including child sex trafficking and sodomy.

title: Michele Tafoya: No amount of hormone therapy will change differences between men and women
description: Former sports reporter Michele Tafoya gives her take on the transgender athlete bill sparking a fight over Title IX on Thursday's "The Story with Martha MacCallum."

title: Texas woman found guilty of killing her daughters
description: A Texas mother who admitted to killing her two young daughters was found guilty Wednesday.

title: Mexican airliner lands in Puerto Vallarta after engine failure
description: A Viva Aerobus flight landed in Puerto Vallarta, Mexico, after a reported engine failure forced the Guadalajara-bound flight to divert its course. No one was injured.

title: Jean-Pierre gets defensive on Biden debt ceiling strategy, shifts blame to McCarthy
description: Reporters pressed White House press secretary Karine Jean-Pierre over President Biden's stance on the budget battle, asking whether the ball is "in his court" on the issue.

title: Dutch diplomat quits amid 'Ukrainians also Russians' comment controversy
description: Veteran Dutch diplomat Ron van Dartel has resigned amid a controversy over a comment made in a new book, an excerpt of which stated "Ukrainians are also Russians."

title: MSNBC guest bizarrely ties Bud Light controversy to recent gun violence: 'Culture of fear'
description: MSNBC guest and ex-GOP strategist Stuart Stevens claimed that conservatives stoking a "culture of fear" has led to the recent bouts of gun violence in America.

title: WATCH: Jean-Pierre cuts off reporter, gets visibility angry over question on Biden's budget responsibilities
description: White House press secretary Karine Jean-Pierre appeared visibly angry as she tussled with a reporter over President Biden's responsibilities pertaining to the budget.

title: Boston Athletic Association apologizes to running clubs after Black members cite racist policing at marathon
description: A few days after a running club claimed racist and "targeted" policing at the Boston Marathon, the Boston Athletics Association issued an apology.

title: Alec Baldwin criminal charges for fatal 'Rust' shooting to be dropped: lawyers
description: Criminal charges against the "30 Rock" star for the shooting death of "Rust" cinematographer Halyna Hutchins will be dismissed, his lawyers told Fox News Digital

title: GOP lawmakers call on Biden to stop sending aid to Ukraine in new letter: report
description: GOP House and Senate lawmakers sent a letter to President Biden Thursday urging the administration to stop sending aid to Ukraine, stating it has only increased tensions with Russia.

title: Wisconsin lawyer, 67, faces up to 90 days for spitting on BLM protestor
description: Stephanie Rapkin, 67, of Shorewood, Wisconsin, has been convicted of misdemeanor disorderly conduct for spitting at a 17-year-old George Floyd protest organizer.

title: Former Minnesota police officer Kim Potter convicted in Daunte Wright death to be freed from prison
description: Ex-Brooklyn Center police officer to be released Monday from prison after more than one year behind bars for the accidental shooting death of Daunte Wright during a traffic stop.

title: 'Glock switch' ban now Indiana law
description: Republican Indiana Gov. Eric Holcomb on Thursday signed a bill imposing a statewide ban on so-called "Glock switches," which can emulate automatic fire on semiautomatic firearms.

title: Florida Gov DeSantis signs bill allowing juries to sentence an inmate to death without unanimous vote
description: Juries in Florida will now be able to sentence an inmate to death without unanimous support following legislation signed by Gov. Ron DeSantis on Thursday.

title: IRS whistleblower is 'game changer' in Hunter Biden probe, says Lindsey Graham
description: Sen. Lindsey Graham, R-S.C., joined "Faulkner Focus" Thursday to react to bombshell allegation of corruption in the investigation of Hunter Biden.

title: IRS commissioner mum on alleged mishandling of Hunter Biden investigation: ‘very little I’m allowed to say’
description: IRS Commissioner Daniel Wefel told Sen. Marsha Blackburn during a meeting Thursday there was very little he could say regarding allegations of mishandling a probe into Hunter Biden.

title: Aaron Carter refused rehabilitation plan from his team before accidental death
description: Aaron Carter's team revealed that they had attempted to get the former pop star the help he needed while he suffered from addiction ahead of his death, but he blew off the plan.

title: DeSantis meets with military veterans at South Carolina coffee shop as 2024 race heats up
description: Florida Republican Gov. Ron DeSantis toured South Carolina on Wednesday, including a stop at a Summerville coffee shop where he chatted with military veterans and local law enforcement.

title: ‘Godfather’ actor Al Pacino says he gave this Hollywood star a career by turning down major movie role
description: "Godfather" star Al Pacino revealed a key role he turned down that made the career of another actor. He also cleared up rumors he was upset with Marlon Brando over Oscar nominations.

title: AOC, other Dems reintroduce trillion-dollar Green New Deal that would end fossil fuels
description: Democratic lawmakers including Rep. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez, D-N.Y., reintroduced the Green New Deal, sweeping legislation that would dramatically slash fossil fuel production.

title: Want to get better sleep? Exercise for this long each day
description: Hoping to get better sleep tonight? Getting this amount of moderate aerobic exercise each day will help to see a benefit, according to a Johns Hopkins Center for Sleep researcher.

title: North Carolina lawmaker defends plan to ban drag shows when minors are present: 'Need to be guardrails'
description: Republican North Carolina state Rep. Jeff Zenger pushed back against accusations that a bill he filed to ban drag shows on public property and in front of minors is discriminatory.

title: New parents need to know about a scary event that happens to some babies. Here's what a 'BRUE' is
description: A Brief Resolved Unexplained Event, or BRUE, is when a baby briefly stops breathing. Pediatric physicians at NYU Langone and Cedars-Sinai shared what it means and what parents should know.

title: Chicago police interim superintendent to step down when mayor-elect Brandon Johnson is sworn in
description: Chicago Police Department Interim Superintendent Eric Carter announced his retirement, which will take effect the same day Brandon Johnson is being sworn in as mayor.

title: Massachusetts town says Avian Flu detected among 24 dead swans
description: Massachusetts officials said the Avian Flu was detected among a cluster of dead swans recently found over several weeks.

title: 'Live' viewers outraged over Kelly Ripa, Mark Consuelos pre-recording shows: 'What a joke'
description: "Live" viewers seemed outraged at Kelly Ripa and Mark Consuelos' pre-recorded episodes of the show this week while Consuelos made his debut as co-host.

title: Michael Schumacher's family to pursue legal action following fake AI-generated interview
description: Michael Schumacher's family plans to take legal action against a German magazine that ran a front cover spread promising an exclusive interview with the seven-time F1 champion.

title: Russia forces Ukrainian children to attend 'military patriotic education' camps in Crimea: defense official
description: A top Ukrainian official has accused Russia of intensifying its efforts to force children in occupied areas of Ukraine to receive "military patriotic education" by sending them to camps in Crimea.

title: Footage of UFOs over conflict zones seen for first time: 'This is devastating'
description: For the first time, a video of a UFO flying in an active combat zone was released to the public, but its existence creates a potential for crossfire because combatants don't know whose asset it belongs to

title: Instagram star Bri Teresi quits lingerie company after hiring of biological male model: ‘Know your audience!'
description: Model and golf influencer Bri Teresa cut ties with Honey Birdette after the lingerie company used a male model to promote its new lingerie line.

title: Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis super PAC makes hires in Iowa, New Hampshire and South Carolina
description: A superPAC supporting a potential Gov. Ron DeSantis White House bid reportedly made key hires in states such as Iowa, New Hampshire and South Carolina.

title: Sacramento Kings remind fans of cowbell ban at Chase Center ahead of Game 3
description: The Sacramento Kings reminded their fans of a ban on cowbells at Chase Center, the home of the Golden State Warriors, ahead of Game 3 of their playoff series.

title: Riley Gaines calls out Democrats who opposed women's sports bill: They will 'pay for this' in 2024
description: Former NCAA swimmer Riley Gaines joined "The Faulkner Focus" after House Republicans passed a bill barring transgender athletes from participating in women's sports.

title: Musk, Bezos, Branson launch into new lap of billionaire space race
description: Elon Musk, Richard Branson and Jeff Bezos have cutting-edge rockets and very deep pockets. Subscribe to Fox Nation to stream the Bill Hemmer-hosted 'Billionaire Space Race.'

title: Missing Madeleine McCann: German court throws out sex charges against suspect in toddler's disappearance
description: Christian Brueckner, a suspect in Madeleine McCann's disappearance, was charged with sex crimes against children in 2022, but a German court dismissed those charges Thursday.

title: New York police make arrest in decades-old murder of cop's daughter
description: New York authorities have arrested Edward V. Holley, 42, in the 2003 murder of Megan McDonald, the 20-year-old daughter of an NYPD detective.

title: Italian politician called racist after saying country should have more kids instead of importing migrants
description: Agriculture Minister Francesco Lollobrigida from Italy’s conservative Brothers of Italy party was criticized after advocating for a higher Italian birthrate.

title: The world lost faith in childhood vaccines during COVID, UNICEF reports
description: The coronavirus pandemic has caused a rise in vaccine hesitancy, according to a UNICEF report. Public perception of polio and measle vaccines for kids have declined.

title: Singapore to execute man who conspired to smuggle 2 pounds of cannabis
description: Singapore plans to resume executions after a six-month hiatus. The country will execute a man found guilty of attempting to traffic two pounds of cannabis onto the island.

title: Schumacher family plans legal action over fake AI 'interview'
description: The family of Formula One champion Michael Schumacher plans to take legal action against a German magazine after it published an "interview" with the racer that was generated using AI.

title: Washington, DC, health insurance exchange admin apologizes to House members for data breach
description: A top administrator of Washington’s District of Columbia Health Benefit Exchange Authority apologized for a data breach that released personal information on members of the Congress.

title: Why this year's Met Gala theme, which honors Karl Lagerfeld, is generating controversy
description: This year’s Met Gala will honor Karl Lagerfeld, the highly celebrated and controversial fashion designer who was regarded as fatphobic. He also spoke against movements such as #MeToo.

title: Rep. Nancy Mace, female Republicans outraged at Democrats for opposing Girls in Sports bill: 'Bulls---'
description: Several Republican female members of Congress met to support a bill to prevent transgender athletes from competing against biological girls in school sports.

title: Sen. Mike Lee blasts Utah professor who called Ron DeSantis a 'fascist,' used swastika in call for protests
description: A Utah Valley University professor is being called out for tweeting an image of Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis with a swastika and calling him a "fascist."

title: Alex Murdaugh's life in lockup: Lawyer reveals exclusive details
description: Alex Murdaugh is a "celebrity of sorts" in prison who passes the time playing checkers with his fellow inmates – many of whom are convicted sex offenders, his lawyer said.

title: US transfers Guantanamo detainee back to home country of Algeria
description: The U.S. announced Thursday that it had transferred Guantanamo detainee Said bin Brahim bin Umran Bakush back to his home country of Algeria.

title: Migrant sailboat crashes in Greece killing 1, 47 others rescued
description: Authorities in Greece said they found one migrant dead and rescued 47 others after their sailboat crashed into rocks and partially sank. The survivors were able to call for help.

title: NATO chief Jens Stoltenberg declares Ukraine's 'rightful place' is in the military alliance
description: The chief of NATO declared that the military alliance will provide more support to Ukraine as the war with Russia continues. He claimed Ukraine's "rightful place" is in the alliance.

title: Rebel ambush kills 5 Indian army soldiers in Kashmir
description: The Indian military said five soldiers were killed Thursday when rebels ambushed a military vehicle in the Himalayan region of Kashmir. The rebels are fighting against Indian rule.

title: Oklahoma court upholds Richard Glossip’s murder conviction
description: An Oklahoma appeals court made the decision to uphold the murder conviction of death row inmate Richard Glossip. Glossip is accused of a 1997 murder-for-hire that killed his ex-boss.

title: McCarthy celebrates House passage of bill protecting women’s sports, says vote fulfills GOP promise
description: House Speaker Kevin McCarthy celebrated the passage of the Protection of Women and Girls in Sports Act Thursday, which he said is a day for "fairness" for women in sports.

title: Wisconsin deputies respond to driver’s ‘curious’ call of ‘bobcat in my car,’ bodycam video shows
description: A bobcat squeezed into the grille of a Toyota sedan in Portage County, Wisconsin, stumping deputies until a warden arrived to help remove the big cat.

title: Kansas City officer kills man who allegedly pointed gun at people
description: A Kansas City officer killed a man who allegedly pointed a gun at people while he was acting erratically. The police officer killed 43-year-old Reginald E. Byers Jr.

title: 'Mean Girls' star Rachel McAdams flaunts armpit hair in provocative photoshoot
description: 44-year-old Hollywood actress Rachel McAdams embraced her body by displaying her armpit hair during a risqué photo shoot on the cover of Bustle.

title: Yellow daffodils, planted in honor of 1943 uprising against Nazi occupiers, bloom in Warsaw
description: Daffodils are seen everywhere in Warsaw, Poland, as residents commemorate the 80th anniversary of the Jewish uprising that opposed Nazi Germany in 1943.

title: North Dakota Gov. Doug Burgum signs bill that bans providing gender reassignment surgeries to minors
description: A bill signed by Gov. Doug Burgum makes it illegal to give gender-affirming surgery to anyone under the age of 18 in North Dakota. All North Dakota Democrats voted against the bill.

title: Caitlyn Jenner calls Joe Biden's Title IX proposal an attempt to 'destroy women’s sports'
description: Caitlyn Jenner, a former Olympic gold medalist, spoke out Wednesday against the Biden administration’s Title IX proposal during an appearance on OutKicks' "Tomi Lahren is Fearless" show.

title: Marine Corps investigating after recruit, 21, dies during physical fitness test
description: Marine recruit Noah Evans, 21, died during a physical fitness training test at a Marine recruit depot in South Carolina on Tuesday. Authorities are investigating his death.

title: Indianapolis high school student dies in hospital after being found shot near intersection
description: A student at Arsenal Technical High School in Indianapolis, Indiana, was found shot near an intersection. The student later died at a hospital.

title: Alabama mass shooting: Police make 4th arrest in Dadeville Sweet 16 attack
description: The Alabama Law Enforcement Agency made a fourth arrest in the Dadeville mass shooting. Johnny Letron Brown faces four counts of reckless murder.

title: North Carolina becomes latest state to pass bill banning trans athletes from girls' sports teams
description: The North Carolina House on Wednesday passed legislation that would prohibit biological males who identify as female from playing on girls' sports teams.

title: Bradley Cooper’s ex Irina Shayk has ‘no time for people’s opinions’
description: Motherhood keeps Irina Shayk so busy, she doesn't have time to think about other people's opinions. The Russian model shares a daughter with ex Bradley Cooper.

title: North Carolina Republicans aim to revoke governor’s ability to pick community college boards
description: Republican lawmakers of a North Carolina Senate committee approved a measure that would allow the General Assembly to revamp the state’s community college boards.

title: US schools race to catch up on reading after COVID stalls academic progress
description: American schools are struggling to improve its students’ reading skills after the coronavirus pandemic disrupted classes and forced children to miss school.

title: Chief Justice Roberts asked to testify in Senate on Supreme Court ethics amid Thomas controversy
description: Senate Judiciary Chairman Dick Durbin invited Chief Justice John Roberts to testify on Supreme Court ethics rules amid controversy surrounding Justice Clarence Thomas' vacations.

title: Famous New York theater company CEO Todd Haimes dies at the age of 66
description: The CEO of the Roundabout Theater Company, Todd Haimes, has died at the age of 66. Haimes turned the company into a major theatrical force during his tenure.

title: Pamela Anderson goes sheer in sparkling bodysuit
description: Pamela Anderson walked the red carpet at an event in New York City, wearing a sparkly, sheer bodysuit and wowing fans and photographers.

title: Wisconsin Republican lawmakers pushing for medical marijuana program
description: Republican lawmakers in Wisconsin are pushing for a medical cannabis program that could be enacted later this year. The state Assembly remains opposed to legalizing recreational pot.

title: Former WI Parole Commission chair charged with felony
